chargeHist.descr: Strangulation and Suffocation (with a Previous Conviction)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Melvin E. Lewis appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.    DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 2 assigned. Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney. Speedy trial demand filed.   Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
to Preliminary Hearing
DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 2 assigned.

Atty Hertz-McGrath is unable to take the case due to calendar unavailability.  Atty Bielski is now appointed.
Denise Hertz-McGrath appointed; repayment to be determined.  kmk
